News Organizations

Many major news organizations are planning to use live video from the television pool coverage by C-Span on their Web sites that will be the same as that broadcast by the television networks. Other Web-based news sites will provide similar coverage and NationalJournal.com, which is normally open only to subscribers, will have open access during the conventions and provide a guide to convention news on the Web.
In addition, America Online will offer video from the convention hall 24 hours a day, while Pseudo.com will have cameras providing a 360-degree view of the hall.

'Political Points' and More Online ''Political Points,'' a live Webcast produced jointly by The New York Times and ABC News, can be viewed daily at 1:30 p.m. and 8 p.m. Eastern time at: www.nytimes.com/politics
abcnews.go.com
Additional coverage is available at both sites, including past Webcasts and, via C-Span, live gavel-to-gavel floor proceedings.
